trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that the string comparison must ignore case.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that the string comparison must ignore symbols, such as white-space characters, punctuation, currency symbols, the percent sign, mathematical symbols, the ampersand, and so on.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxxxx$xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx xxxx$ xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxxx$ xxx xx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that the string comparison must ignore the character width.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source: For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx$ Xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxxx$xxxxx xx xxxx$xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
If this value is selected, the katakana characters written as full-width are considered equal to the same characters written as half-width.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxx$xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxx$xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates the default option settings for string comparisons.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

String comparison must ignore case, then perform an ordinal comparison.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx$ xxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This technique is equivalent to converting the string to uppercase using the invariant culture and then performing an ordinal comparison on the result.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that the string comparison must use the string sort algorithm.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
In a string sort, the hyphen and the apostrophe, as well as other nonalphanumeric symbols, come before alphanumeric characters.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx x xxxxxx xxxx$ xxx xxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x
